00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the TWSI / I2C bus
00044  *
00045  * Note: Currently on 7 bit device addresses are supported
00046  *
00047  * <hr>$Revision: 153454 $<hr>
00048  *
00049  */
00050 
00051 #ifndef __CVMX_TWSI_H__
00052 #define __CVMX_TWSI_H__
00053 
00054 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00055 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00056 extern "C" {
00057 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00061     /* Extra TWSI Bus Opcodes */
00062 #define TWSI_SLAVE_ADD     0
00063 #define TWSI_DATA          1
00064 #define TWSI_CTL           2
00065 #define TWSI_CLKCTL_STAT   3    /* R=0 selects CLKCTL, R=1 selects STAT */
00066 #define TWSI_STAT          3    /* when R = 1 */
00067 #define TWSI_SLAVE_ADD_EXT 4
00068 #define TWSI_RST           7
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Do a twsi read from a 7 bit device address using an (optional) internal address.
00073  * Up to 8 bytes can be read at a time.
00074  *
00075  * @param twsi_id   which Octeon TWSI bus to use
00076  * @param dev_addr  Device address (7 bit)
00077  * @param internal_addr
00078  *                  Internal address.  Can be 0, 1 or 2 bytes in width
00079  * @param num_bytes Number of data bytes to read
00080  * @param ia_width_bytes
00081  *                  Internal address size in bytes (0, 1, or 2)
00082  * @param data      Pointer argument where the read data is returned.
00083  *
00084  * @return read data returned in 'data' argument
00085  *         Number of bytes read on success
00086  *         -1 on failure
00087  */
00088 int cvmx_twsix_read_ia(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint16_t internal_addr, int num_bytes, int ia_width_bytes, uint64_t * data);
00089 
00090 /**
00091  * A convenience wrapper function around cvmx_twsix_read_ia() that
00092  * only supports 8 bit internal addresses.
00093  * Reads up to 7 bytes, and returns both the value read or error
00094  * value in the return value
00095  *
00096  * @param twsi_id   which Octeon TWSI bus to use
00097  * @param dev_addr  Device address (7 bit only)
00098  * @param internal_addr
00099  *                  Internal address (8 bit only)
00100  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to read (0-7)
00101  *
00102  * @return Value read from TWSI on success
00103  *         -1 on error
00104  */
00105 static inline int64_t cvmx_twsix_read_ia8(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint8_t internal_addr, int num_bytes)
00106 {
00107     uint64_t data;
00108     if (num_bytes < 1 || num_bytes > 7)
00109         return -1;
00110     if (cvmx_twsix_read_ia(twsi_id, dev_addr, internal_addr, num_bytes, 1, &data) < 0)
00111         return -1;
00112     return data;
00113 }
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * A convenience wrapper function around cvmx_twsix_read_ia() that
00117  * only supports 16 bit internal addresses.
00118  * Reads up to 7 bytes, and returns both the value read or error
00119  * value in the return value
00120  *
00121  * @param twsi_id   which Octeon TWSI bus to use
00122  * @param dev_addr  Device address (7 bit only)
00123  * @param internal_addr
00124  *                  Internal address (16 bit only)
00125  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to read (0-7)
00126  *
00127  * @return Value read from TWSI on success
00128  *         -1 on error
00129  */ static inline int64_t cvmx_twsix_read_ia16(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint16_t internal_addr, int num_bytes)
00130 {
00131     uint64_t data;
00132     if (num_bytes < 1 || num_bytes > 7)
00133         return -1;
00134     if (cvmx_twsix_read_ia(twsi_id, dev_addr, internal_addr, num_bytes, 2, &data) < 0)
00135         return -1;
00136     return data;
00137 }
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * Read from a TWSI device (7 bit device address only) without generating any
00141  * internal addresses.
00142  * Read from 1-8 bytes and returns them in the data pointer.
00143  *
00144  * @param twsi_id   TWSI interface on Octeon to use
00145  * @param dev_addr  TWSI device address (7 bit only)
00146  * @param num_bytes number of bytes to read
00147  * @param data      Pointer to data read from TWSI device
00148  *
00149  * @return Number of bytes read on success
00150  *         -1 on error
00151  */
00152 int cvmx_twsix_read(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, int num_bytes, uint64_t * data);
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * Perform a twsi write operation to a 7 bit device address.
00156  *
00157  * Note that many eeprom devices have page restrictions regarding address boundaries
00158  * that can be crossed in one write operation.  This is device dependent, and this routine
00159  * does nothing in this regard.
00160  * This command does not generate any internal addressess.
00161  *
00162  * @param twsi_id   Octeon TWSI interface to use
00163  * @param dev_addr  TWSI device address
00164  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to write (between 1 and 8 inclusive)
00165  * @param data      Data to write
00166  *
00167  * @return 0 on success
00168  *         -1 on failure
00169  */
00170 int cvmx_twsix_write(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, int num_bytes, uint64_t data);
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * Write 1-8 bytes to a TWSI device using an internal address.
00174  *
00175  * @param twsi_id   which TWSI interface on Octeon to use
00176  * @param dev_addr  TWSI device address (7 bit only)
00177  * @param internal_addr
00178  *                  TWSI internal address (0, 8, or 16 bits)
00179  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to write (1-8)
00180  * @param ia_width_bytes
00181  *                  internal address width, in bytes (0, 1, 2)
00182  * @param data      Data to write.  Data is written MSB first on the twsi bus, and only the lower
00183  *                  num_bytes bytes of the argument are valid.  (If a 2 byte write is done, only
00184  *                  the low 2 bytes of the argument is used.
00185  *
00186  * @return Number of bytes read on success,
00187  *         -1 on error
00188  */
00189 int cvmx_twsix_write_ia(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint16_t internal_addr, int num_bytes, int ia_width_bytes, uint64_t data);
00190 
00191 /***********************************************************************
00192 ** Functions below are deprecated, and not recomended for use.
00193 ** They have been superceded by more flexible functions that are
00194 ** now provided.
00195 ************************************************************************/
00196 
00197 /**
00198  * Read 8-bit from a device on the TWSI / I2C bus
00199  *
00200  * @param twsi_id  Which TWSI bus to use. CN3XXX, CN58XX, and CN50XX only
00201  *                 support 0. CN56XX and CN57XX support 0-1.
00202  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00203  * @param internal_addr
00204  *                 Internal device address
00205  *
00206  * @return 8-bit data or < 0 in case of error
00207  */
00208 static inline int cvmx_twsix_read8(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint8_t internal_addr)
00209 {
00210     return cvmx_twsix_read_ia8(twsi_id, dev_addr, internal_addr, 1);
00211 }
00212 
00213 /**
00214  * Read 8-bit from a device on the TWSI / I2C bus
00215  *
00216  * Uses current internal address
00217  *
00218  * @param twsi_id  Which TWSI bus to use. CN3XXX, CN58XX, and CN50XX only
00219  *                 support 0. CN56XX and CN57XX support 0-1.
00220  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00221  *
00222  * @return 8-bit value or < 0 in case of error
00223  */
00224 static inline int cvmx_twsix_read8_cur_addr(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr)
00225 {
00226     uint64_t data;
00227 
00228     if (cvmx_twsix_read(twsi_id, dev_addr, 1, &data) < 0)
00229         return -1;
00230     return (data & 0xff);
00231 }
00232 
00233 /**
00234  * Write 8-bit to a device on the TWSI / I2C bus
00235  *
00236  * @param twsi_id  Which TWSI bus to use. CN3XXX, CN58XX, and CN50XX only
00237  *                 support 0. CN56XX and CN57XX support 0-1.
00238  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00239  * @param internal_addr
00240  *                 Internal device address
00241  * @param data     Data to be written
00242  *
00243  * @return 0 on success and < 0 in case of error
00244  */
00245 static inline int cvmx_twsix_write8(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr, uint8_t internal_addr, uint8_t data)
00246 {
00247     if (cvmx_twsix_write_ia(twsi_id, dev_addr, internal_addr, 1, 1, data) < 0)
00248         return -1;
00249     return 0;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /**
00253  * Read 8-bit from a device on the TWSI / I2C bus zero.
00254  *
00255  * This function is for compatibility with SDK 1.6.0 and
00256  * before which only supported a single TWSI bus.
00257  *
00258  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00259  * @param internal_addr
00260  *                 Internal device address
00261  *
00262  * @return 8-bit data or < 0 in case of error
00263  */
00264 static inline int cvmx_twsi_read8(uint8_t dev_addr, uint8_t internal_addr)
00265 {
00266     return cvmx_twsix_read8(0, dev_addr, internal_addr);
00267 }
00268 
00269 /**
00270  * Read 8-bit from a device on the TWSI / I2C bus zero.
00271  *
00272  * Uses current internal address
00273  *
00274  * This function is for compatibility with SDK 1.6.0 and
00275  * before which only supported a single TWSI bus.
00276  *
00277  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00278  *
00279  * @return 8-bit value or < 0 in case of error
00280  */
00281 static inline int cvmx_twsi_read8_cur_addr(uint8_t dev_addr)
00282 {
00283     return cvmx_twsix_read8_cur_addr(0, dev_addr);
00284 }
00285 
00286 /**
00287  * Write 8-bit to a device on the TWSI / I2C bus zero.
00288  * This function is for compatibility with SDK 1.6.0 and
00289  * before which only supported a single TWSI bus.
00290  *
00291  * @param dev_addr I2C device address (7 bit)
00292  * @param internal_addr
00293  *                 Internal device address
00294  * @param data     Data to be written
00295  *
00296  * @return 0 on success and < 0 in case of error
00297  */
00298 static inline int cvmx_twsi_write8(uint8_t dev_addr, uint8_t internal_addr, uint8_t data)
00299 {
00300     return cvmx_twsix_write8(0, dev_addr, internal_addr, data);
00301 }
00302 
00303 /**
00304  * Read up to 256 bytes to a TWSI device using an internal address.
00305  *
00306  * @param twsi_id   Which TWSI interface on Octeon to use
00307  * @param dev_addr  TWSI device address (7 bit only)
00308  * @param internal_addr
00309  *                  TWSI internal address (8 or 16 bits)
00310  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to read (1-256)
00311  * @param ia_width_bytes
00312  *                  Internal address width, in bytes (1 or 2)
00313  * @param data      Data to read. Data is read MSB first on the twsi bus,
00314  *                  and only the higher "num_bytes" bytes of the argument are
00315  *                  valid. (If a 2 byte read is done, only the high 2 bytes of
00316  *                  the argument is used.
00317  * @return          0 on success; -1 on error
00318  */
00319 int cvmx_twsix_read_ia_llc(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr,
00320                uint16_t internal_addr, int num_bytes,
00321                int ia_width_bytes, uint64_t *data);
00322 
00323 /**
00324  * Write up to 256 bytes to a TWSI device using an internal address.
00325  *
00326  * @param twsi_id   Which TWSI interface on Octeon to use
00327  * @param dev_addr  TWSI device address (7 bit only)
00328  * @param internal_addr
00329  *                  TWSI internal address (8 or 16 bits)
00330  * @param num_bytes Number of bytes to write (1-256)
00331  * @param ia_width_bytes
00332  *                  Internal address width, in bytes (1 or 2)
00333  * @param data      Data to write. Data is written MSB first on the twsi bus,
00334  *                  and only the higher "num_bytes" bytes of the argument are
00335  *                  valid. (If a 2 byte write is done, only the high 2 bytes of
00336  *                  the argument is used.
00337  * @return          0 on success; -1 on error
00338  */
00339 int cvmx_twsix_write_ia_llc(int twsi_id, uint8_t dev_addr,
00340                 uint16_t internal_addr, int num_bytes,
00341                 int ia_width_bytes, uint64_t *data);
00342

00345 }
